bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to Henry Rose Carter, June 5, 1919

div1.p: Noguchi writes that he is sending Carter articles on yellow fever in Guayaquil.

div1.head: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to Henry Rose Carter, June 5, 1919
div1.opener:
CABLE ADDRESS
ROCKSTITUTE
THE ROCKEFELLER INSTITUTE
FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH.
66TH STREET AND AVENUE A.
NEW YORK.
June 5, 1919
Missc
Y. F.
Noguchi
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Under another cover I am sending
you the number of the Journal of Experimental Medi-
cine which contains the first three articles on
the work done with yellow fever in Guayaquil. It
occurred to me that as you are probably going to
participate in the discussion of yellow fever at the
meeting in Atlantic City you might wish to have seen
the papers, and the reprints are not yet available.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Hideyo Noguchi Answered
Dr. H. R. Carter
Medical Officer in Charge
U. S. Public Health Service
Baltimore, Maryland
